sn45.34:1.2: “Mendicants, when these eight things are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
sn45.34:1.4: They are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn45.34:1.5: When these eight things are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.”
sn45.34:2.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn45.34:2.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn45.34:3.2: who cross to the far shore.
sn45.34:4.1: When the teaching is well explained,
sn45.34:4.3: are the ones who will cross over
sn45.34:4.4: Death’s domain so hard to pass.
sn45.34:5.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
sn45.34:5.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
sn45.34:6.1: you should try to find delight there,
sn45.34:6.3: With no possessions, an astute person
sn45.34:6.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
sn45.34:7.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
sn45.34:7.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
